executive_summary: In 2018, CBD products became legal at the federal level. Prior to this, CBD products were illegal at the federal level but legal in many states and with increased frequency. As a result, many areas had a framework in place, so robust growth followed. Still, with states increasingly legalizing CBD products prior to the federal legalization, explosive growth had been ongoing. As the pandemic hit, consumers reduced spending, and CBD producers contended with possibilities of a saturated market. More likely, the industry is normalizing, indicated by relatively slower growth in recent years. Over the past five years, revenue has been growing at a CAGR of 9.6% and is estimated to reach $1.3 billion in 2023 when sales will sink 1.4%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Some pockets of the country are still ripe for producers.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: For instance, though federally legalized earlier, South Dakota continued outlawing CBD until 2020. As a result, in recent years, growth in the state has outpaced the national average. Still, the aging and normalization of the industry is a positive trend for the top producers. Due to the influx of new players, average profit is slim, weighed down by nonexistent margins of nascent entrants and stymied by overcrowding. As the underperforming players begin falling away and fewer new producers enter the field, profit is expanding

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Normalization of CBD product availability will result in tamed expansion
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As CBD products become more readily available and normalized throughout culture, the craze for such products will dwindle and space for new producers will tighten up. Some producers will be forced to exit the space, as consumers begin exhibiting brand loyalty toward certain products and businesses emerge as major players in the field. Acquisition activity will likely increase, as established businesses begin making moves to expand and grow their production capacity along with market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Heightened competition will place pressure on sales but likely spur innovation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Fewer state-level restrictions will enable companies to grow across state lines with greater ease, allowing for larger companies to form and take hold of greater swaths of revenue. Competition from recreational marijuana dispensaries and other supplement manufacturers will intensify in the coming years, forcing some out of the industry, as sales begin to fall. The most successful manufacturers are likely to pair up with alcoholic beverage producers and sport drinks producer, among others, to create new CBD-infused offerings.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Opportunities for substantial growth will dwindle with fewer untapped areas
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With fewer states holding out in legalizing CBD products, few new regions are expected to emerge in which explosive growth can take place. International trade is difficult with CBD products, due to domestic and international regulations, which vary significantly. For most producers, tapping a foreign market will be difficult and costly, so trade is expected to remain negligible for most and provide little relief to slowing growth at home.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Persistently high operating costs will drive some out
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Operating costs will remain high in the coming years, and wages are forecast to increase as a share of revenue, placing greater pressure on producers' margins. Though hemp prices will likely continue falling, purchase costs will remain high with greater investment in advanced technologies, research and development and automated tech. Profit will remain constrained, declining marginally, due to rising operational costs coupled with heightened competition resulting in pricing pressure on producers.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry use hemp to produce cannabidiol (CBD) oil, which is used to create supplements, foods and concentrates.
key_trends: A relatively small potential market and many producers make competition intense. A relatively small portion of the population regularly uses CBD products, but favorable regulations in recent years have caused many to enter the field. As a result, competition is high and increasing.
More states legalizing recreational marijuana sales means greater competition
Federal legalization in 2018 expanded CBD production
As the novelty of CBD wanes, so will its explosive growth
Astronomical expansion leads to many companies but no giants
Regulation is changing at a relatively swift pace
Little public assistance is available to producers
Purchase costs are high and can be volatile
An influx of new producers keeps wage costs high
States with long-standing favorable laws have a high concentration of producers
In areas where laws recently changed, production booms
Topicals and tinctures lead the way
State-specific age requirements limit markets in certain areas

market_segmentation.segment_description: The market segment including consumers between the ages of 18 and 25 is the smallest source of revenue for CBD producers, largely because of the age restrictions most states have placed on hemp-derived CBD products, which range from 18 to 21.

Working-age adults typically have a steadier flow of income than older or younger cohorts and no issues with age-restrictions on products, enabling them to purchase CBD products with greater regularity. Since most grew up when such products were largely illegal, the age range displays a great sense of curiosity and willingness to try CBD products, and since they typically have fewer long-term health issues than older markets, they are willing to experiment with more product types.

Working-age adults typically have a steadier flow of income than older or younger cohorts and no issues with age-restrictions on products, enabling them to purchase CBD products with greater regularity. Since most grew up when such products were largely illegal, the age range displays a great sense of curiosity and willingness to try CBD products, and since they typically have fewer long-term health issues than older markets, they are willing to experiment with more product types.

Older consumers have displayed a greater willingness to try topical CBD products marketed through health retailers, along with tinctures, as they are familiar and the question of inebriation is moot. The preconceived notions many older consumers carry around marijuana have made the oldest consumer segment more difficult to market other product varieties to, and since many are inundated with supplements and medications, it can be difficult to product regular customers.

Older consumers have displayed a greater willingness to try topical CBD products marketed through health retailers, along with tinctures, as they are familiar and the question of inebriation is moot. The preconceived notions many older consumers carry around marijuana have made the oldest consumer segment more difficult to market other product varieties to, and since many are inundated with supplements and medications, it can be difficult to product regular customers.

products_and_services.product_description: The food and beverages segment includes a variety of food and beverages, ranging from cookies and candy to seltzer and soda, infused with some form of CBD. Often, these products have other supplements as well, like melatonin or caffeine.

Topicals include creams, ointments, lotions, gels and other similar products that have been infused with CBD. Many consumers unaccustomed to using marijuana or marijuana-based products are more likely to try topicals than an ingested form of CBD products.

Tinctures are made from CBD extract, so a serving is very small, typically applied with a dropper sublingually or mixed in a beverage like coffee, tea or water. Many health-conscious individuals are familiar with tinctures, as they are made from various ingredients, making them accessible to many.

There is a range of other CBD products, most notably including hemp-derived cannabis flower and pre-rolled joints with THC levels below 0.3% but high CBD levels, vaporizer cartridges and CBD concentrates made for smoking or vaporizing.

tier_1_suppliers: CBD Product Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Printing, Paper, Food, Textile & Other Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Tractors & Agricultural Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Per capita disposable income determines an individual's ability to purchase goods or services. It is calculated by taking income earned from all sources minus taxes, savings and some non-tax payments and dividing by the total US population. Since CBD products are largely viewed as discretionary purchases, sales are influenced by disposable income levels. Expanding disposable income could present a potential opportunity for producers.

business_locations.location_description: The Plains has the highest concentration of CBD product manufacturers in the country, with many drawn to the region due to its relatively low cost of operation. The distribution of CBD product manufacturers changes fairly quickly, given the new nature of the field and state-level regulations. South Dakota held out on banning CBD products, even after the 2018 federal legalization, weighing down the region's share of producers. In 2020, South Dakota legalized the sale and use of most CBD products, with some restrictions, resulting in the state booming with activity.

The Rocky Mountains contains the second-highest share of CBD product producers, mostly because several states in the region have had favorable laws toward the products for decades. Montana first legalized hemp-based CBD products in 2001, becoming the state with the most producers, given its history in the field. Colorado legalized CBD and THC producers in 2012 and quickly became and remains a hotbed of activity, though competition is high.

The Southwest region is home to the third-largest share of CBD product manufacturers, mostly due to the relatively low operational costs available. Less than 1.0% of hemp is grown outdoors, so suppliers are typically located in areas where large indoor growing facilities can be inexpensively run. Locating close to suppliers is a key to keeping purchase and transportation costs low. Texas and Oklahoma contain the highest shares in the region due to their large rural areas which command lower rent and utility costs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Agricultural Improvement Act of 2018 removed hemp and hemp seeds from the list of Controlled Substances, establishing a federal hemp regulatory system under the United States Department of Agriculture. Through the Act, hemp containing less than 0.3% THC (the psychoactive chemical in cannabis) is considered a legal agricultural commodity and is now eligible for the federal crop insurance program.

The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has verified no CBD products as medicinal drugs, and CDB products cannot be marketed as dietary supplements. Any producer or seller marketing CBD products for medicinal use or as dietary supplements is in violation of the FD&C Act.

While CBD products are legal at the federal level, there is a patchwork of rapidly changing laws and regulations that govern CBD products in states. Hemp-derived products, including CBD products, are legal for at least medicinal use in most states, though there are notable exceptions or additional rules imposed by certain states.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The legal landscape surrounding CBD products is changing rapidly and often differs on the federal and state levels. New producers must ensure they understand the laws pertaining to where they are setting up shop, along with overarching federal laws.
Start-up costs for a CBD product manufacturer are moderate. A new owner must invest in a relatively large space, some large equipment for production.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition is intense due to small potential market and many producers
basis_points.basis_description: A relatively small portion of the population regularly uses CBD products, but favorable regulations in recent years have caused many to enter the field.

basis_points.basis_title: More states legalizing recreational marijuana increases competition
basis_points.basis_description: Recreational marijuana dispensaries sell products with CBD, along with a range of related goods. A rise in recreational legalization shrinks the market for hemp-based CBD products.

concentration_points.concentration_title: No major player has emerged yet
concentration_points.concentration_description: Though CBD products have been legal at various state levels for some time, federal legalization only occurred in 2018, followed by explosive growth in the number of producers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Market fragmentation due to quick expansion
concentration_points.concentration_description: Quick expansion resulted in fragmentation, with many companies offering similar products to the same markets, unable to capture a significant share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: RAPID EXPANSION AND RELATIVELY FEW SPECIALISTS DRIVE UP WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Newer companies tend to allocate greater funds toward employees, rather than new equipment which could reduce the reliance on employees due to lack of funds. Given the relatively young nature of CBD products, many companies are still relatively small and cannot employ automated tech on a grand scale for production. Since CBD products are relatively new, there are few specialists on such products, so finding and retaining those with special knowledge can be costly. More producers have allocated funds toward acquiring a highly-skilled workforce, boosting wage costs in recent years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PROFIT IS LOW BUT SHOWING SIGNS OF GROWTH AS NEW ENTRANTS SLOW
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: With eyes on CBD production given its newness and popularity, new producers flooded the market with many selling the same or similar goods, placing downward pressure on profit. In 2023, the flood of new producers began easing and continues falling, easing competition a bit and enabling successful producers to gain their footing and generate steadier profit. Volatile profit is common for new, booming industries, especially in one so highly regulated and scrutinized. Yet, as more producers reach a stable point of operation, fluctuations will ease.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASE COSTS ARE ROBUST BUT A RISING NUMBER OF GROWERS IS REDUCING COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: CBD products are made from chemicals found in hemp, which by law must contain less than 0.3% THC, which is still illegal on the federal level, so hemp represents the largest purchase cost for most producers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Though starting a new CBD product manufacturing facility can be costly, as some large equipment is required, wage costs are quite high, accounting for roughly one-third of revenue. Since the field is still new, few automated processes have been employed, causing many to rely on physical workers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: CBD-Infused Beverages Could Become a Source of Competition
volatility_points.volatility_description: CBD-infused beverages still account for a relatively small share of revenue, but the popularity of such products is booming. For producers, beverages could provide a way to compete with alcoholic beverage producers or even pair up with similar businesses for CBD and alcoholic-infused drinks.

volatility_points.volatility_title: REGULATORY CHANGES SEND WAVES THROUGH A RELATIVELY SMALL LANDSCAPE
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since the production of CBD products is still so new, regulatory changes have the ability to create big changes quickly. State-level changes can cause quick bursts of revenue, as new markets are effectively created, generating revenue where once there was none. The permittance of many CBD products and the producers stems from the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 which federally legalized many CBD products, but changes to it can cause massive disruption. State-level regulations have begun popping up, especially as illegal products have bled into parts of the supply chain, raising concerns among many. Regulatory hurdles typically deter new entrants and reduce sales for existing producers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE NEWNESS OF MANY BUSINESSES IMBUES CONDITIONS WITH VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: While some form of CBD products have been around for some time, the influx of CBD producers is still a relatively new phenomenon, largely beginning in 2018, so new entrants have flooded the space since, causing massive volatility. Conditions are regularly changing for producers, ranging from suppliers, which have proliferated following positive regulatory changes in many areas.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging online advertising?
FAQs.answer: Creating a brand presence online can attract new customers. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) furthered the importance of being accessible online.

FAQs.question: What are your target markets for products?
FAQs.answer: Target markets may depend on the type of product, for example, products used for medical purposes versus for recreational.

FAQs.question: Does your operation focus on one product, or do you offer a range?
FAQs.answer: Product diversification can protect your business from unexpected drops in revenue.

FAQs.question: What are your biggest input costs? How many suppliers do you work with?
FAQs.answer: Fluctuating input costs can dampen profitability.

FAQs.question: What new equipment have you recently invested in?
FAQs.answer: The manufacturing of CBD products requires equipment that ensures products are meeting regulations.

FAQs.question: Where can you increase your company's level of automation?
FAQs.answer: Certain industry-specific machines aid in manufacturing CBD products.

FAQs.question: How are you prepared to adapt to a changing regulatory environment?
FAQs.answer: Staying on top of the latest legislation can help prepare for and reduce compliance costs.

FAQs.question: What agencies are your primary regulators?
FAQs.answer: Ensuring your operation is compliant with state-specific regulations is key to long-term success.

FAQs.question: How profitable is your operation, compared with your competitors?
FAQs.answer: On average, profit margins are around -5.0% of total revenue.

FAQs.question: Will you have any challenges securing financing for upcoming equipment purchases?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturing equipment is evolving and improving constantly, and replacement of equipment may be a large expense.

FAQs.question: How does your company manage to adjust to changing or vague regulations?
FAQs.answer: Although the 2018 Farm Bill legalized hemp production and the production of hemp derivatives, states still have differing regulations for specific products. Adhering to government regulations is essential for operators success.

FAQs.question: How have recent regulation changes affected your company? Are you quick to adapt to change?
FAQs.answer: Regulations are constantly changing. Manufacturers must comply with the latest legislation or risk fines or arrest, and they must be able to adjust to changing regulation quickly and smoothly. COVID-19 regulations may also affect the industry.

FAQs.question: What is your greatest source of external competition?
FAQs.answer: CBD Products compete against conventional healthcare services and products due to the alternative and unconventional nature of their treatment.

FAQs.question: How do you market the benefits of your product to skeptical consumers?
How does an increase in the number of adults aged 50 and older affect demand for your company? How do you take advantage of this increased demand?
FAQs.answer: Individuals aged 50 and older are more likely to require medical CBD products that this industry provides since many health conditions that CBD products are used for are prevalent among members of this age group.
